It's a classic romantic comedy that uses witty dialogue and introspective storytelling to explore relationships in an unconventional way. Both films are sure to provide a delightful viewing experience!

If you're in the mood for a quirky and humorous movie, I highly recommend "The Big Lebowski." It's a screwball comedy that follows the misadventures of an laid-back bowler who gets mistaken for a millionaire with the same name. Jeff Bridges delivers an outstanding performance as The Dude.

For a different kind of comedic twist, you might also enjoy "The Nutty Professor." In this film, a shy professor invents a magical potion that allows him to transform into a suave and charming alter ego. It's a fun and energetic watch, with standout performances by Eddie Murphy in dual roles.

In this hilarious film, Ben Stiller's character goes to meet his girlfriend's parents but soon finds himself in a series of absurd situations. It's a great watch if you're looking for some laughter!

If you'd like another recommendation, "Serving Sara" (2002) might also tickle your funny bone. Starring Matthew Perry as a process server trying to serve an elusive female target, this film offers plenty of comedic twists and turns. Enjoy the ride!

I'd highly recommend "City of Ghosts" for you! This documentary showcases a group of brave activists facing realities undercover, on the run, and in exile, risking their lives to stand up against ISIS. Although it might not be like Men in Black, it's an inspiring story of courage and resilience.

If you're looking for something a bit different, "Island of the Blue Dolphins" is another intriguing film that tells the story of a Native American girl abandoned on an island and protected by a wild dog. Enjoy the journey!

Based on your interest in deeper stories and the Khmer language, I'd highly recommend watching "Smilla's Sense of Snow." This film is a thrilling mystery that follows a woman investigating the death of an Inuit boy in Copenhagen, which leads her on a journey to Greenland.

If you're looking for something more lighthearted with Will Smith involved, I suggest checking out "I, Robot," where he plays a detective investigating crimes perpetrated by robots in the future. Both films offer engaging plots and memorable performances. Enjoy your movie time!
